recommendations.food: The .45 Express (Section ) - A ballpark-only hot dog from Torchy’s Tacos that’s topped with hot Cheetos, queso, pico, and sour cream before being wrapped into a tortilla.
recommendations.drink: Texas Amber by ZiegenBock Brewery Company
recommendations.attraction: Union Station Lobby is the main entrance to Minute Maid Park, and the former concourse of Houston's original Union Station built in 1911.

recommendations.food: Junior's Deep Friend New York Cheesecake
recommendations.drink: Metropolitan Lager by Flagship Brewery
recommendations.attraction: The Mets' Home Run Apple. When a Mets player hits a home run, a giant apple, which has a Mets logo on the front that lights up, rises from the center field batter's eye.

recommendations.food: The Happy Dog Stand's Killer Kilbane Dog
recommendations.drink: Burning River Pale Ale by Great Lakes Brewing Co
recommendations.attraction: The stacked bullpens in the Right Field District are one of the most unique layouts in Major League baseball. They provide an awesome view of player warmups and incredible access to the players. Plus, three rows of seats just in front of the bullpens offer a unique seating option with great views of the entire field.

recommendations.food: Ben's Chilli Bowl's Half Smoke(Sections 110 & 141) - It’s a half-pork, half-beef sausage that’s smoked and then served slathered in cheese, onions and chili.
recommendations.drink: The Citizen by DC Brau Brewing Company
recommendations.attraction: The iconic Presidents Race is held at every game at Nationals Park, in the middle of the fourth inning. It features presidents George Washington, Thomas Jefferson, Abraham Lincoln, Theodore Roosevelt and is always full of surprises and guest cameos.

recommendations.food: Sweet Baby Ray's Barbeque (Sections 221 & 422) - Burnt Ends Basket
recommendations.drink: ¡Vamos! by Boulevard Brewing Company
recommendations.attraction: The park's best-known feature is the fountain and waterfall display known as the Water Spectacular behind the right-field fence. At 322 feet, it is the largest privately funded fountain in the world. The fountains are on display before and after the game and in-between innings, while the waterfalls are constantly flowing.

recommendations.drink: Green Line Pale Ale by Goose Island

recommendations.food: 557 Smokehouse's Wicked Pig (Section 49) - $27 sandwich starts with a sweet Hawaiian roll, which is then piled high with pulled pork, thick cut Danish bacon, a split sausage, prosciutto, and thick sliced ham. Coleslaw, barbecue sauce, and pork rinds round out this meaty offering.
recommendations.drink: Shiner Bock by Shiner
recommendations.attraction: A four story office building is located in center field that you can rent by the game or as a permenent office space.

recommendations.drink: Manny's Pale Ale by Georgetown Brewing
recommendations.attraction: Art in the Park - Safeco Field and its adjoining parking garage features local art displays each game.

recommendations.food: Taste of Chase's D-bat Dog (Section 130) - An 18 inch corn dog stuffed with jalapeno, cheddar cheese and bacon, then served on a bed of fries.
recommendations.drink: Kilt Lifter by Four Peaks Brewing Company
recommendations.attraction: Watch the game from the pool and hottub located in right field.

recommendations.drink: Jai Alai by Cigar City Brewing
recommendations.attraction: Rays Touch Tank

recommendations.drink: Spotted Cow by New Glarus Brewing
recommendations.attraction: The Racing Sausages and Bernie the Brewer's Slide.

recommendations.drink: Blueberry Lager by Rivertown Brewing
recommendations.attraction: The Power Stacks

recommendations.drink: NY Pinstripe Pilsner by Blue Point Brewing Company
recommendations.attraction: New York Yankees Museum

recommendations.drink: 312 by Goose Island
recommendations.attraction: Iconic ivy covered outfield walls.

recommendations.drink: Karl Strauss’ Red Trolley Ale by Golden Road Brewing
recommendations.attraction: Iconic Haloed A Sculpture

recommendations.food: Shibe Park Tavern's Ahi Poke Tacos
recommendations.drink: Little Sumpin' Sumpin' by Lagunitas
recommendations.attraction: Unique design to allow for both football and baseball.

recommendations.food: Elote - One of Mexico's most popular street food, this roasted corn on the cob comes with cotija cheese, mayonnaise and chili powder
recommendations.drink: Dodgers Blonde by Golden Road Brewing
recommendations.attraction: 10 story elevator shaft behind home plate

recommendations.drink: Busch Light by Anheuser-Busch
recommendations.attraction: Ballpark Village and amazing view of the Gateway Arch

recommendations.drink: National Bohemian Beer by Pabst Brewing Company
recommendations.attraction: The old B&O's warehouse wall acts as the ballpark's surrounding wall.

recommendations.food: The Broham Pulled Pork Sandwich at Phil's BBQ
recommendations.drink: San Diego Pale Ale .394 by AleSmith Brewing Company
recommendations.attraction: The Park at the Park

recommendations.food: Liberty Village Sausage Poutine at Toronto Street Eats
recommendations.drink: Rally Cap by Left Field Brewery
recommendations.attraction: The first ever full retractable domed roof

recommendations.drink: Boston Lager by Samuel Adams
recommendations.attraction: Oldest ballpark in the nation

recommendations.drink: Iron City Lager by Pittsburgh Brewing Company
recommendations.attraction: The Great Pierogi Race, is a race that features six contestants racing in giant pierogi costumes: Potato Pete, Jalapeño Hannah, Cheese Chester, Sauerkraut Saul, Oliver Onion, Bacon Burt, and Pizza Penny.

recommendations.drink: Chopsecutioner by Terrapin Brewing Company
recommendations.attraction: Monument Garden

recommendations.food: Grecian French Fries at The Corktown Stand
recommendations.drink: Two Hearted by Bells
recommendations.attraction: The Ferris Wheel behind the third base line

recommendations.drink: Shark Bait by Miami Brewing Company
recommendations.attraction: The Homerun Marlin

recommendations.drink: Yuengling Lager by Yuengling
recommendations.attraction: Neon Liberty Bell

recommendations.drink: Come Hell or High Watermelon by 21st Amendment
recommendations.attraction: Giant Coke Bottle and Baseball Glove

recommendations.drink: Rockpile by SandLot Brewery at Coors Field
recommendations.attraction: The Rooftop
